name.richardson.james.bukkit.utilities.plugin

Interface Localisable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommandManager, PluginCommand, SimplePlugin

    public interface Localisable
    The Localisable interface represents an object which is able to localise strings for output to the user.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getChoiceFormattedMessage(String key, Object[] arguments, String[] formats, double[] limits)
      Gets the choice formatted message.
      Locale getLocale()
      Gets the current locale.
      String getMessage(String key)
      Gets a localised message by providing a message key.
      String getSimpleFormattedMessage(String key, Object argument)
      Gets the simple formatted message.
      String getSimpleFormattedMessage(String key, Object[] arguments)
      Gets the simple formatted message.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocale

        Locale getLocale()
        Gets the current locale. This should return the locale of the messages returned by the class implementing this interface.
        Returns:
        the locale

      • getMessage

        String getMessage(String key)
        Gets a localised message by providing a message key. This returns a string from the ResourceBundle, providing that it exists. This method does not do any additional formatting beyond returning the localised message.
        Parameters:
        key - Specifies the key of the message to look up in the ResourceBundle.
        Returns:
        The localised message matching the key supplied.

      • getSimpleFormattedMessage

        String getSimpleFormattedMessage(String key,
                               Object[] arguments)
        Gets the simple formatted message. This method returns a localised message replacing place holders in the string with the arguments provided.
        Parameters:
        key - Specifies the key of the message to look up in the ResourceBundle.
        arguments - The arguments to use to format the message and replace the place holders.
        Returns:
        The localised message matching the key supplied and with the placeholders replaced.

      • getSimpleFormattedMessage

        String getSimpleFormattedMessage(String key,
                               Object argument)
        Gets the simple formatted message. This method returns a localised message replacing place holder in the string with the argument provided. It is a convenience method to avoid creating an array of a single String.
        Parameters:
        key - Specifies the key of the message to look up in the ResourceBundle.
        argument - The argument to use to format the message and replace the place holder.
        Returns:
        The localised message matching the key supplied and with the placeholder replaced.

      • getChoiceFormattedMessage

        String getChoiceFormattedMessage(String key,
                               Object[] arguments,
                               String[] formats,
                               double[] limits)
        Gets the choice formatted message. This method returns a localised message replacing place holder in the string with the arguments provided. Additionally it alters the formatting of the message depending on the formats and limits provided. This can return messages such as "1 ban" or "2 bans".
        Parameters:
        key - Specifies the key of the message to look up in the ResourceBundle.
        formats - The formats to use when matched to a limit. For example {"no bans", "one ban"}.
        limits - The limits as Doubles. For example {0,1}.
        choice - The format to use.
        Returns:
        The localised message matching the key supplied and with the placeholder replaced.
